entry.title: b1tg/CVE-2023-38831-winrar-exploit
entry.summary:
CVE-2023-38831 winrar exploit generator

CVE-2023-38831 winrar exploit generator

Quick poc test

Generate the default poc for test

python cve-2023-38831-exp-gen.py poc
or
python cve-2023-38831-exp-gen.py CLASSIFIED_DOCUMENTS.pdf script.bat  poc.rar

Custom

  1. Place the bait file and (evil) script file in the current directory, the bait file is recommended to be an image (.png, jpg) or a document (.pdf)
  2. Run python cve-2023-38831-exp-gen.py <bait name> <script name> <output name> to generate your exploit

Screenshots

Infected version: winrar <= 6.22

Reference

https://www.group-ib.com/blog/cve-2023-38831-winrar-zero-day/

entry.title: continuedev/continue
entry.summary:
‚è© the open-source autopilot for software development‚Äîbring the power of ChatGPT to VS Code

üéÅ New!: Use Code Llama with Continue

Continue

Continue is the open-source autopilot for software development‚Äîa VS Code extension that brings the power of ChatGPT to your IDE

Task, not tab, auto-complete

Answer coding questions

Highlight sections of code and ask Continue for another perspective

  • ‚Äúhow can I set up a Prisma schema that cascades deletes?‚Äù
  • ‚Äúwhere in the page should I be making this request to the backend?‚Äù
  • ‚Äúhow can I communicate between these iframes?‚Äù

Edit in natural language

Highlight a section of code and instruct Continue to refactor it

  • ‚Äú/edit migrate this digital ocean terraform file into one that works for GCP‚Äù
  • ‚Äú/edit change this plot into a bar chart in this dashboard component‚Äù
  • ‚Äú/edit rewrite this function to be async‚Äù

Generate files from scratch

Open a blank file and let Continue start new Python scripts, React components, etc.

  • ‚Äú/edit here is a connector for postgres, now write one for kafka‚Äù
  • ‚Äú/edit make an IAM policy that creates a user with read-only access to S3‚Äù
  • ‚Äú/edit use this schema to write me a SQL query that gets recently churned users‚Äù

Getting Started

Download for VS Code

By default, Continue uses GPT-4 and GPT-3.5-turbo via the OpenAI API.

You can adjust the config to use different LLMs, including local, private models. Read more here.

License

Apache 2.0 ¬© 2023 Continue Dev, Inc.

entry.title: watchtowrlabs/juniper-rce_cve-2023-36844
entry.summary:
CVE-2023-36844 , CVE-2023-36845 , CVE-2023-36846 , CVE-2023-36847

A Proof of Concept for chaining the CVEs [CVE-2023-36844, CVE-2023-36845, CVE-2023-36846, CVE-2023-36847] developed by @watchTowr to achieve Remote Code Execution in Juniper JunOS within SRX and EX Series products.

Follow the watchTowr Labs Team for our Security Research

  • https://labs.watchtowr.com/
  • https://twitter.com/watchtowrcyber
  • https://twitter.com/alizthehax0r

Technical Analysis

watchTowr performed a deep dive into reproducing, chaining and exploiting these vulnerabilities which can be found at: https://labs.watchtowr.com/cve-2023-36844-and-friends-rce-in-juniper-firewalls/

Summary

  1. A pre-authentication upload vulnerability can be used to upload an arbitrary PHP file to a restricted directory with a randomised file name.
  2. Using the same vulnerable function, we upload a PHP configuration file (.ini) which points to and loads the PHP file from step 1 using the auto_prepend_file directive.
  3. As all environment variables can be set via HTTP requests, we overwrite the environment variable PHPRC to load the PHP configuration file from step 2 and trigger the execution of the PHP function declared in step 1.

Usage

The PHP function can be specified using the flag ‚Äîpayload, however php_uname() is set by default.

python watchtowr-vs-junos_juniper_2023-08-25.py --url http://localhost

python watchtowr-vs-junos_juniper_2023-08-25.py --url http://localhost --payload "get_current_user()"

Mitigations

Update to the latest version of JunOS, and/or apply the patches provided by Juniper. If these actions are not possible, please leverage the provided Juniper workaround.

https://supportportal.juniper.net/s/article/2023-08-Out-of-Cycle-Security-Bulletin-Junos-OS-SRX-Series-and-EX-Series-Multiple-vulnerabilities-in-J-Web-can-be-combined-to-allow-a-preAuth-Remote-Code-Execution?language=en_US
